contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox Former Municipality Japan |Name= Ryūyō |JapaneseName= 竜洋町 |MapImage=Map.Ryuro.Shizuoka.PNG |Since=April 1, 2005 |Currently=[[Iwata, Shizuoka|Iwata]] |Region=[[Chūbu region]] ([[Tōkai region]]) |Prefecture=[[Shizuoka Prefecture|Shizuoka]] |District=[[Iwata District, Shizuoka|Iwata District]], |Area=23.62 |PopDate=April 1, 2005 |Population=19,756 |Density=836 |Tree= [[pine]] |Flower= [[Salvia splendens|Scarlet sage]] |Bird= |Coord= |CityHallLink= }} {{Nihongo|'''Ryūyō'''|竜洋町|Ryūyō-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Iwata District, Shizuoka|Iwata District]], [[Shizuoka Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On April 1, 2005 Ryūyō, along with the towns of [[Fukude, Shizuoka|Fukude]] and [[Toyoda, Shizuoka|Toyoda]], and the village of [[Toyooka, Shizuoka|Toyooka]], all from [[Iwata District, Shizuoka|Iwata District]], was [[Merger and dissolution of municipalities of Japan|merged]] into the city of [[Iwata, Shizuoka|Iwata]] and thus it no longer exists as an independent municipality. At the time of its merger, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 19,756 and a [[population density|density]] of 836 persons per km². The total area was 23.62 km². {{DEFAULTSORT:Ryuyo, Shizuoka}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Shizuoka Prefecture]] {{Shizuoka-geo-stub}}
